name: mosaic ridge pullover
notes:

add this pattern to your cart to unlock the exclusive discounted price—don't miss this sale!**

❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

fall in love with the **mosaic ridge adult pullover**! this stunning piece is worked in the round, using a top-down yoke style that makes for a seamless and cozy fit. 


the mosaic colorwork technique adds a unique texture while easy increases throughout the yoke keep the pattern approachable. with **mary maxim mellowspun yarn** for the main solid color and **mary maxim prism yarn** (featuring slow ombre color changes) for the mosaic details, this sweater has a dynamic look that’s both bold and elegant.

get this pattern in a kit on [mary maxim][2]

this sweater pattern comes with a [video tutorial][3].

crochet hook:
[4.5mm - or size to meet gauge][4]

notions:
[removable stitch markers][5]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][6]
[scissors][7]

yarn:
[mary maxim mellowspun][8]
100% acrylic, 284yds/100g
color a: shown in white or sand

[mary maxim prism][9]
100% acrylic, 290yds/100g
color b: shown in autumn mist or sunset

yardage:
total yardage: 1140 (1190, 1250, 1300, 1375) (1450, 1530, 1610, 1690)
main color a yardage:  820 (855, 900, 935, 990) (1040, 1102, 1160, 1215); 3 (4, 4, 4, 4) (4, 4, 5, 5) skeins
accent color b yardage: 320 (335, 350, 365, 385) (410, 428, 450, 475); 2 skeins each color

yarn substitutions
[wecrochet swish][10] - 100% fine superwash merino wool 110yds/50g

[premier anti-pilling everyday dk yarn][11] -100% acrylic, 273yds/100g

[premier colorfusion dk yarn][12] - 100% acrylic, 325yds/100g

abbreviations
blo - back loop only
ch - chain
dc - double crochet
ehdc - extended half double crochet
ehdc2tog - extended half double crochet two together
rnd - round
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)

gauge:
5 sts and 16 rows = 4" by 4" worked in the overlay mosaic pattern
15 sts and 10 rows = 4" by 4" worked in the ehdc

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][13]

sizes:
xs (s, m, l, 1x) (2x, 3x, 4x, 5x)
to fit chest:
32 (34, 38, 42, 46) (50, 54, 58, 62)

actual measurements:
32 (35.5, 39.5, 42.5, 47) (51, 55.5, 59.75, 64)

this garment has an oversized relaxed fit and is meant to be worn with a 2-4 inch ease. for a more fitted look, go down a size.

skill level:
intermediate
